item.title: Data Science Director
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group offering insurance and wealth management solutions in the US, Canada, Europe, and Asia

We are on a transformational journey. We want to remove complexity from the financial services industry, to make people’s lives better by helping to make their decisions easier. Being part of this transformation is hugely exciting and offers talented, ambitious people an amazing opportunity to build a career. We value innovation and have a proven track-record, with a unique behavioral insurance offering that rewards customers for living a longer, healthier life. 

We are looking for a Data Science Director to join our US Segment Advanced Analytics team. Your job will be to build and execute against our strategy and drive initiatives that result in increased business value.  Your primary focus will be on supporting our US insurance marketing and B2B sales teams with advanced analytics & AI based solutions. 
 

Who We Are
 

John Hancock’s Advanced Analytics & AI team works across the US Insurance business to optimize our sales and marketing activities, make life insurance easy to buy, and streamline inforce and claims operations.  We have close relationships with functional leadership across the business and a strong working relationship with technology partners. As part of a 160+ member community of data scientists, John Hancock, and our parent Manulife, you will have an opportunity to network with experts across the globe.
 

What You Will Do

You will be at the center of where Advanced Analytics meets the business growth. Your team will engage with both business and technical executive leadership to identify areas where analytics can influence sales, prescribe sales team activities, and segment marketing messages in the complex, dynamic brokerage insurance market. 

 
The Role Will Be Directly Responsible For
 

  • Owning the data science & analytics product roadmap, prioritization and delivery of Advanced Analytics & AI use cases across distribution and marketing

  • Leading and developing a strong, highly motivated team of data scientists

  • Evangelizing team’s accomplishments with executives and identify changing priorities within overall enterprise to further orient the team’s direction

  • Advocating for advanced analytics & AI use cases by engaging with our Continuous Delivery Org, our Agile delivery function

  • Building strong collaborative relationships across different Analytics and business teams during high pressure/fast paced delivery cycles

  • As a member of the US Segment Advanced Analytics leadership team, identifying process enhancements and opportunities to improve our data architecture, analytics/ML tools and practices to enable the team’s efficiency

Typical Qualifications
 

Bachelor’s Degree with 5+ year’s experience, or Master’s with any of the following fields: Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Math, Engineering, Operation Research, Statistics, Epidemiology, Public Health or other related quantitative fields.

Professional Experience may include

  • Expertise delivering analytic & machine learning products, with a deep understanding of agile product delivery in an enterprise environment

  • Building and leading project teams in a matrix environment, managing cross functional teams

  • Experience leading or working with data scientists and engineers

  • Familiarity with machine learning and advanced analytics concepts

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to engage the enterprise across multiple specializations with analytically backed compelling stories

  • Prior experience with life insurance or financial services is not required

item.title: Associate Data Scientist
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

The candidate will be a part of the Group Advanced Analytics team and will be tasked with assisting in the development and execution of robust analytical solutions to various parts of the Manulife business. The candidate must have a passion for how Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning can be leveraged and used to drive deeper, meaningful insights that enhance the customer experience, grow our businesses, minimize risk and engage our employees.

How does Manulife differentiate as the employer of choice to build a career in Advanced Analytics?

1. Value at Manulife, Advanced Analytics is a change agent.

We are a business partner that helps with transforming the company using analytics to drive insight, action, and value in everything Manulife does. The teams work closely with business leaders, build business cases, and quantify the business value of the opportunity to the organization.

The successful candidate will work with the team and the business unit to:

  • Convert the business opportunity into an analytical problem.

  • Measure the size of the opportunity.

  • Determine key performance measures (KPIs) to track success.

  • Use a variety of statistical and machine learning techniques to solve the problem.

  • Demonstrate shared value through the conversion of algorithms into a business process.

2. Challenging opportunities exist for qualified candidates.

  • Candidates are expected to hold a Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, Data Science or a related quantitative field.

  • Must be proficient in programming (Python), algorithms and data structures.

  • Must be familiar with Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing and Deep Learning, and should demonstrate their knowledge through the past projects (academic or industrial).

  • Should demonstrate the knowledge of applied statistics and its usage in data analysis and feature engineering.

  • Good to have knowledge of big data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop and cloud platforms like Azure Machine Learning.

  • Good to have the knowledge of Reinforcement Learning or Graph Analytics.

3. Continuous Development

Manulife is committed to learning and development. The candidate will be introduced to a seasoned and eminent analytics leader in the organization who will act as a mentor. Employees have access to and can expect to participate in:

  • In-house Kaggle-style data science competitions

  • Team and networking events

  • Monthly Global Best Practice meetings

  • Conferences/Training courses

  • Presentations to Executives

item.title: Lead Data Analyst
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Accountabilities:

  • Provides analysis on datasets of high complexity to identify outliers, anomalies, patterns, or other compliance indicators that may be hidden in the data and communicates results of analysis to senior audit management, analytics lead and business partners.

  • Trains and supports audit teams in the analysis of captured data as well as technical training to to more junior analysts in the DA team and auditors across all levels

  • Acts as a Consultant by owning and delivering the analytical project planning for 1 - 2 audits at a time, performing analysis and guiding more junior analysts so that the project is completed successfully and on time.

  • Identifies and works towards acquiring access to data that supports audit and automation initiatives

  • Works with Auditors to Identify opportunities for automation and provides analyses to support the initiatives – automates control testing, works on projects that deliver Continuous Auditing and Monitoring

  • Actively contributes to cross functional audit projects to develop analytics enabled solutions on data appropriateness for quality and accuracy, data validation, consolidation and cleansing processes.

  • Works on problems of high complexity, following standard practices and data analytics procedures to evaluate controls and business objectives

  • Develops and maintains strong internal network at all levels of the organization, relationships with other Analytics counterparts within the organization

  • Speaker and active participant at external events and conferences

  • Contributes to the development of Audit Services DA policies, strategy and direction; continually improve audit and supporting processes leveraging technology to the fullest

Job Requirement:

  • Bachelor\'s Degree in a technical (computer science, statistics, math, etc.) or generally an advanced degree in a quantitative discipline. Advanced degree preferred.

  • Advanced knowledge and at least 5 years of experience in data analytics, data wrangling, programming, data visualization

  • Advanced demonstrated knowledge of SQL, Python (or R, SAS), VBA, MS Excel, connecting to various databases

  • Demonstrated experience in building dashboards/solutions using visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and using Python/R visualization libraries

  • Experience working on various data platforms, with structured and unstructured data

  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, cluster, decision trees, Natural Language Processing)

  • Expertise in helping define business problems or objectives and successfully designing and executing analytics solutions

  • Experience in leading/influencing without authority, project and timelines management

  • Experience in influencing stakeholders, leading, motivating and mentoring peers

  • Deep knowledge of using data analytics for auditing purposes is preferred.

Competencies:

  • Advanced technical competencies (programming, data wrangling, data visualization, exploratory data analysis)

  • Applied machine learning and model production skills

  • Detailed oriented with a problem-solving mind set, critical thinking

  • Turn statistical and computational analysis into user-friendly graphs, charts, and animation. Enable those who aren’t professional data analysts to effectively interpret data. Ability to communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations

  • Exceptional influencing, relationship building and negotiation skills; professional presence, ability to navigate within a matrix environment and influence across different areas and all levels of management both in Audit Services and the business

item.title: Assistant Vice President, Group Functions Data Office
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

About the Job
 
The Assistant Vice President, Group Functions Data Office is responsible for leading and executing a strategic roadmap for collecting, storing, processing enterprise & divisional data to support and enable analytics, digital transformation and operational improvements. This involves researching, recommending and choosing optimal solutions to manage and implement modern data architecture as well as maintaining and monitoring the success of these solutions. The incumbent must have a passion for how data can be leveraged and used to drive deeper, meaningful insights that enhance the customer experience, grow our businesses, minimize risk and engage our employees globally.

The role involves creating a team of highly skilled data engineering professionals while guiding and implementing industry best practices around data governance to ensure business and analytical needs are well understood and satisfied. The incumbent will participate in long range strategic planning that addresses complex data management challenges. Projects are highly complex, multi-faceted and involve many stakeholders. The overall accountabilities support analytics, executive decision making and direct customer- facing activities. In addition, the role provides thought leadership and consultative support to the many data activities across the organization.

As the AVP, Group Functions Data Office, you will:

  • Enable software development across key Group Functions priorities through an embedded team of data analysts and data engineers, with a focus on accelerating consistent implementation of engineering patterns and approaches to deliver on key business priorities;
     
  • Aligning to and in partnership with the Global Data Office, guide, contribute and adopt the development and evolution of engineering patterns, best practices, and reference implementations to consistently increase the rate of sharing and reuse across the globe;
     
  • Promote and adopt data governance and stewardship by embedding the concepts within the software development lifecycle;
     
  • Oversee and develop a distributed team of data analysts and data engineers;
     
  • Ability & preference to work in an Agile environment;
     
  • Bring strong leadership and a collaboration mindset to work horizontally across the firm to realize a comprehensive data strategy;
     
  • Understand complex data integrations and business information models to drive the simplification of the data ecosystem;
     
  • Bring strong operational and engineering excellence and ability to drive continuous improvement;
     
  • Maintain an enterprise view on the evolution of data technologies and software engineering, and nurture experimentation in support of understanding emerging technologies;
     
  • Collaborate with business partners, analytics teams, software developers, platform engineers, and engineering leadership to uncover pain points and opportunities to accelerate the delivery of new value through software;
     
  • Lead, drive and influence innovative data solutions for GWAM working closely with Technology and Operations teams.

Specifically, for Global Data Technology, the role will drive, lead and manage:

(1) Modern Data Architecture in Azure: Setting the strategic rollout and delivery of proven as well as emerging tooling to ensure that data pipelines are scalable, repeatable and secure serving multiple users within the organization. The incumbent is responsible for all providing leadership and direction for highly complex, multi-faceted big data initiatives associated the following functions areas:
 

  • Translate complex functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture, design and high performing capabilities;
  • Lead the design and build of data patterns and services - both batch, real-time and complex event handing - leveraging open technologies;
  • Ensure the timely delivery and constant communication of commitments meeting the expectations of stakeholders;
  • Effectively manage operational risk and change with a continuous focus on process improvements.

(2) People and Relationship Management: Responsible for providing information, expertise and direction to a team of full time and contract staff, specifically:
 

  • Responsible for all team goal planning, achievement assessments and employee development plans;
  • Work closely with analytic and data management teams to determine resource requirements and planning.
  • Encourage and ensure all team members participate in cross-training and job sharing; create an annual plan for skill development and advanced technical capabilities.
  • Lead workshops, data engineering meetups, user group facilitation and meet with key stakeholders globally to drive and grow data engineering talent across Manulife.
  • Build and foster strong relationships with key stakeholders across the Advanced Analytics and Group Functions community

(3) Governance and Controls: Responsible for ensuring all data management processes conform to standard operating procedures and aligns with how a modern data architecture aligns to enterprise technology standards and policies; contribute and provide guidance around data quality, metadata management, data stewardship and security, and access controls.

(4) Innovation and Continuous Improvement: Provide thought leadership and guidance around advancing new data technologies and capabilities that are value-driven; work closely with Manulife’s innovation teams (i.e., LOFT), remain current with industry advancements working closely external vendors as well connected to the Apache Foundation projects; develop actionable plans to improve operations and capabilities that have real cost, time and quality benefits.

Qualifications:

  • Over 10 years of demonstrated success architecting and delivering data-centric initiatives and platforms
  • Over 10 years of demonstrated experience with Waterfall and Agile project delivery methodologies, as well as DevOps principles, test-driven development, continuous integration, and other software development lifecycle approaches to accelerate the delivery of new features
  • Over 10 years’ experience in Financial Services (e.g., banking, brokerages, asset management, insurance)
  • Robust understanding of various data design patterns and architectural principles (e.g. Kimball vs. Inmon models, designing for the cloud, Lambda architecture)
  • Experimenting with emerging technologies and understanding how they will impact what comes next
  • A capacity for constant learning from both success and failure, and remaining open to change and continuous improvement
  • Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities that enable you to manage through creative abrasion
  • Strong verbal and written communication with the ability to effectively articulate and communicate technical vision, possibilities, and outcomes across all levels in the organization
  • Developing junior data analysts and data engineers, and a passion for growing staff within the organization   

Last year Manulife spent over $1 BN on technology.  You will be working with:

  • Operational and Informational data integration technologies (Apache Open Projects, Kafka, IBM MQ, Informatica, Hadoop, Web Services)
  • Cloud infrastructure and other components supporting a highly-automated global engineering platform
  • Open source technologies
  • Languages such as SQL, Hive-SQL, Java, JavaScript, Python, .NET, HTML5, CSS3, Swift and other similar technologies
  • Business Intelligence & Analytics tools (e.g. Python, R, SAS, Power BI, Qlik, Tableau)
  • Variety of data platforms (e.g. Synapse, ADLS, Databricks, Hadoop, Spark, SQL Server, Oracle, H-Base, MongoDB)
  • Cutting edge Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning software
  • Digital and mobile technologies
